Variations.organisms: Likely Organisms: Staph. aureus, Strep. pneumoniae, Neisseria. meningitidis, Step. pyogenes (Group A strep), Occasionally Gram-negative bacilli.
Variations.antimicrobial:
Antimicrobial & Dosage: Flucloxacillin 2g iv qds
Plus
Cefotaxime 2g iv qds
+/-
Gentamicin 5mg/kg/day iv od
Variations.alternative:
Alternative Antimicrobial: Penicillin allergy (non anaphylaxis):
Vancomycin 15mg/kg iv bd
Plus
Cefotaxime 2g iv qds
+/-
Gentamicin 5mg/kg/day iv od
Variations.comments:
Comments: Perform full septic screen. Always take blood cultures first (minimum 2 sets).
Refer to Connolly Hospital Surviving Sepsis Guidelines Seek advice from Consultant Microbiologist if in doubt or in setting of penicillin anaphylaxis

Variations.condition: Clinical Condition: Community-acquired if intra- abdominal source suspected
Variations.organisms: Likely Organisms: Predominantly Gram negatives and anaerobes Enterococci may also feature
Variations.antimicrobial:
Antimircobial & Dosage: Co-amoxiclav 1.2g iv tds
+/-
Gentamicin 5mg/kg/day iv od (based on patient history, previous antibiotic use, clinical assessment, etc.)
Or
Amoxicillin 1g iv qds
Plus
Gentamicin 5mg/kg/day iv od
Plus
Metronidazole 500mg iv tds
Variations.alternative:
Alternative Antimicrobial: Penicillin allergy (non anaphylaxis) Cefuroxime 1.5g iv tds
Plus
Metronidazole 500mg iv tds
+/-
Gentamicin 5mg/kg/day iv od

Penicillin allergy (anaphylaxis): Vancomycin 15mg/kg iv bd Plus Gentamicin 5mg/kg/day iv od Plus Metronidazole 500mg iv tds
Variations.comments:
Comments:Perform full septic screen
Seek advice from Consultant Microbiologist if necessary
Send intra-operative samples (preferably pus not swabs) for culture if surgical intervention performed

Variations.organisms: Likely Organisms: Varies: Antimicrobial resistant gram- negative bacilli and meticillin resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) more likely
Variations.antimicrobial:
Antimicrobial & Dosage: Piperacillin-tazobactam 4.5g iv tds
+/-
Gentamicin 5mg/kg/day iv od (base treatment choice on patient history, previous antibiotic use, microbiology results, clinical assessment, etc.)
Variations.comments: Comments: Always take blood cultures first. Empiric treatment guided by previous antimicrobial treatment and culture results to date (review MRSA status and consider addition of Vancomycin if known to be colonised with MRSA)

Variations.organisms: Likely Organisms: Predominantly gram- positive organisms (e.g. Staphylococus aureus, Beta haemolytic streptococci)
Variations.alternative: Alternative Antimicrobial: Penicillin allergy/MRSA positive: Discuss with microbiologist
Variations.comments: Comments:Tissue or pus specimen from ulcer to be sent for culture and sensitivity (here and below rationalise treatment based on c+s). Always review previous culture results as this will guide therapy. Management includes wound care – clean, debride (antibiotics do not penetrate necrotic tissue) and offload pressure. Discuss care with endocrinology team

Variations.condition: Clinical Condition: Infected deep ulcer/ infected ulcer with mild (<2cm) cellulitis
Variations.organisms: Likely Organisms: Predominantly gram- positive organisms (e.g. Staphylococus aureus, Beta haemolytic streptococci)*
Variations.antimicrobial:
Antimircobial & Dosage: Flucloxacillin 500mg po qds*

Duration: 10-14 days (duration depends on extent of tissue injury involvement, adequacy of debridement and wound vasculature)
Variations.alternative:
Alternative Antimicrobial: Penicillin allergy/MRSA positive: Discuss with microbiologist
*If chronic ulcers, recent antibiotic use and foot ischaemia or gangrene consider polymicrobial aetiology and need for co-amoxiclav instead of flucloxacillin
Variations.comments:
Comments: As above
Patient may require IV antibiotics.
Contact microbiologist to discuss risk assessment regarding ciprofloxacin use in case of suspected pseudomonal infection.

Variations.condition: Clinical Condition: Infected foot ulcer with severe (>2cm) cellulitis
Variations.antimicrobial: Antimicrobial & Dosage: Flucloxacillin 2g iv qds Plus Ciprofloxacin 400mg iv bd Plus Metronidazole 500mg iv tds. Duration: 14 days (duration depends on extent of tissue injury involvement, adequacy of debridement and wound vasculature)
Variations.alternative: Alternative Antimicrobial: Penicillin allergy/MRSA positive: Vancomycin 15mg/kg iv bd Plus Ciprofloxacin 400mg iv bd Plus Metronidazole 500mg iv tds.
Variations.comments:
Comments: Ulcer debridement and send tissue sample or pus to microbiology.

If the patient has a past history of C. difficile contact the microbiologist regarding an alternative to ciprofloxacin for antibiotic therapy.

Variations.condition: Clinical Condition: Infected foot ulcer with suspected osteomyelitis
Variations.antimicrobial:
Antimircobial & Dosage: Flucloxacillin 2g iv qds Plus Ciprofloxacin 400mg iv bd Plus Metronidazole 500mg iv tds.
Duration: 8 weeks – 3 months (duration depends on acute or chronic presentation).
Variations.alternative: Alternative Antimicrobial: Penicillin allergy/MRSA positive: Vancomycin 15mg/kg iv bd Plus Ciprofloxacin 400mg iv bd Plus Metronidazole 500mg iv tds
Variations.comments:
Comments: Orthopaedic consultation regarding the need for bone biopsy and bone culture and in the setting of chronic osteomyelitis the need for bone debridement
Discuss treatment plan with microbiologist
